feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Blizzard Warning issued April 01 at 12:46PM AKDT until April 02 at 12:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT AKDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions occurring. Travel will be very difficult to impossible. Winds gusting to 50 mph will cause whiteout conditions in blowing snow. Significant drifting snow is likely. Cold wind chills to 50 below zero are occuring.

entry.title: Wind Advisory issued April 01 at 12:33PM AKDT until April 01 at 6:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Northeast winds 25 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. * WHERE...Over Summits of the Steese Highway. * WHEN...Until 6 PM AKDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Large snow drifts will form. Blowing snow may briefly reduce visibility.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued April 01 at 2:47PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Gusty Winds With Blowing Dust and Choppy Lake Conditions on Sunday and Monday... A series of weak disturbances will brush north of our area this weekend. Westerly winds sustained 15 to 25 mph with gusts of 30 to 40 mph is likely across much of the region. Wind prone areas may see gusts up to 50 mph which may be hazardous to high profile

entry.cap:areaDesc: Olympics; West Slopes North Cascades and Passes; West Slopes North Central Cascades and Passes; West Slopes South Central Cascades and Passes

entry.title: Winter Storm Watch issued April 01 at 2:44PM PDT until April 05 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...LATE SEASON WINTER STORM TO DELIVER HEAVY SNOW TO THE CASCADE CREST... .Snow will increase Sunday evening and become heavy at times into Monday. Snow over the Cascade crest will continue to accumulate through Monday night into Tuesday morning. Winter travel conditions will be possible along Highway 2 from Coles Corner to Stevens Pass.

entry.title: Winter Storm Watch issued April 01 at 2:29PM PDT until April 05 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING ABOVE 2500 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible above 2500 feet. Total snow accumulations of 12 to 24 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph on Monday and Monday night. * WHERE...East Slopes of the Washington Cascades.
entry.cap:areaDesc: East Slopes of the Washington Cascades

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued April 01 at 11:44AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...THREAT OF RIVER FLOODING MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING FOR MASON AND KING COUNTIES... A couple of frontal systems will bring rain, heavy at times, Sunday night through Tuesday with sharp rises on rivers during this period. Rainfall totals of 3 to 6 inches are expected for the Cascades and Olympics. This could cause rivers in Mason County and King County to

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued April 01 at 2:48PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HAZARDOUS TRAVEL CONDITIONS POSSIBLE SATURDAY MORNING... Slippery travel conditions are possible late tonight into Saturday morning due to light snow expected to develop. Slushy accumulations will only be in the one-half to one inch range by midday Saturday. Untreated roads may be snow-covered in spots. Drivers should exercise caution if planning to travel either late

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 01 at 2:11PM CDT until April 02 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM TO 10 AM CDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Wet snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches. * WHERE...In Wisconsin, Grant County. In Iowa, Fayette and Clayton Counties.
